episodeTitle: How's That for Profit? Money Lender Zenny's Ambition!
episodeTitleJapanese: 儲かりまっか？金貸しゼニィの野望！
description: The Straw Hat Pirates help Zenny complete his ship while learning about his past as a money lender to pirates and his lifelong dream of becoming the Pirate King. Marines attempt to ambush them, but Zenny intervenes to protect his new friends.

events.title: Straw Hats Help Repair Zenny's Ship
events.description: The Straw Hat crew works together to repair Zenny's ship, with Zoro chopping wood, goats passing materials, and the crew trying to calm the impatient Zenny. Nami makes him sit while Robin offers a shoulder massage.
events.significance: Demonstrates the Straw Hats' compassion and willingness to help those in need, even during their own journey.

quotes.speaker: Zenny
quotes.context: Zenny explains to Sanji why his ship is on top of the mountain

events.title: Zenny's Past as a Money Lender Revealed
events.description: Zenny reveals his history as a money lender to pirates. He would loan money to pirates and when they didn't return it, he would rig their ships with explosives to intimidate them into paying him back.
events.significance: Provides character depth to Zenny and explains his unique background and financial savvy.

quotes.text: I was known as the money lender Zenny. Pirates were not returning the loaned money, so I always went face to face with them to get my money back.
quotes.speaker: Zenny
quotes.context: Zenny explains his past profession and methods

events.title: Zenny's Dream of Becoming Pirate King
events.description: Zenny shares his childhood dream of becoming the Pirate King. He reveals that his ship was destroyed by pirates 20 years ago, causing him to drift to the island. He built his ship on the mountain because he couldn't bring the wood to the sea, but by the time he completed it, he had become too old to sail the Grand Line.
events.significance: Parallels Luffy's dream and reinforces the theme that dreams are worth pursuing at any age, while also showing the tragedy of deferred dreams.

quotes.text: My dream was to become the Pirate King.
quotes.speaker: Zenny
quotes.context: Zenny reveals his lifelong ambition to the Straw Hats

events.title: Zoro Realizes Zenny Has Outlived His Prognosis
events.description: Zoro notices that Zenny has survived beyond Chopper's three-day prediction, suggesting the old man is recovering from his illness.
events.significance: Shows that Zenny's renewed spirit and purpose from helping the Straw Hats may be contributing to his unexpected recovery.

events.title: Marine Fleet Arrives at Goat Island
events.description: Morning comes and Chopper spots a Marine ship approaching. Sergeant Minchey arrives claiming he came with only one ship to inspect the island, demanding Zenny and the Straw Hats leave immediately.
events.significance: Escalates the tension as the Marines close in on the Straw Hat Pirates during their good deed.

quotes.text: I came with only one ship just to inspect the island. You and the Straw Hat Pirates should leave immediately as other Marines might come for them.
quotes.speaker: Minchey
quotes.context: Minchey's deceptive claim to the pirates

events.title: Hidden Marine Fleet Revealed
events.description: A huge Marine fleet is revealed to be hiding in the fog behind Minchey's ship, planning to attack the pirates when they leave. The Straw Hats easily see through this trick.
events.significance: Demonstrates the Straw Hats' growing tactical awareness and the Marines' willingness to use deception to capture them.

events.title: Marines Take Usopp Hostage
events.description: Usopp is captured by the Marines and used as leverage to force the Straw Hats to drop their weapons. The crew prepares to fight but is stopped by the hostage situation.
events.significance: Creates a tense standoff that will need to be resolved, showcasing the Marines' tactical approach.

quotes.speaker: Zenny
quotes.context: Explaining why his ship is on the mountain

quotes.text: I was known as the money lender Zenny. Pirates were not returning the loaned money, so I always went face to face with them to get my money back.
quotes.speaker: Zenny

quotes.text: My dream was to become the Pirate King.
quotes.speaker: Zenny
quotes.context: Sharing his lifelong ambition with the Straw Hats

quotes.text: I came with only one ship just to inspect the island. You and the Straw Hat Pirates should leave immediately as other Marines might come for them.
quotes.speaker: Minchey
quotes.context: Deceptively trying to lure the pirates into a trap

themes.description: Zenny's lifelong dream of becoming the Pirate King mirrors Luffy's ambition, reinforcing the idea that dreams are worth pursuing regardless of age or circumstances.
themes.symbolism: Zenny's ship on the mountain represents dreams that seem unreachable but are worth pursuing anyway.

themes.description: The Straw Hats dedicate their time and effort to help Zenny complete his ship, showing their compassionate nature despite being pursued by the Marines.
themes.symbolism: The crew working together to help an elderly stranger reinforces their bonds and moral values.

themes.description: Zenny's story of building a ship but becoming too old to sail it explores the tragedy of dreams delayed or deferred, contrasting with the Straw Hats' immediate pursuit of their goals.
themes.symbolism: The ship on the mountain symbolizes opportunities missed due to circumstances beyond one's control.

characterSpotlights.development: Zenny's backstory is revealed, showing his past as a money lender to pirates and his lifelong dream of becoming the Pirate King. His character serves as a mirror to Luffy, showing what happens when dreams are deferred.
keyActions: Tells his story as a money lender to pirates
Reveals his dream of becoming the Pirate King
Explains how he got stranded on the island 20 years ago
Accepts help from the Straw Hats to finish his ship
quotes: I was known as the money lender Zenny.
My dream was to become the Pirate King.

characterSpotlights.development: Zoro shows his observant nature by noticing that Zenny has outlived Chopper's prognosis, and contributes to the ship repairs through hard labor.
keyActions: Observes that Zenny has survived longer than expected
Helps protect the crew when Marines arrive

mangaDifferences.difference: This entire episode is anime-only filler content and does not appear in the manga. The Goat Island Arc was created to give Oda time to get ahead in the manga before the Jaya Arc began.

trivia.fact: This episode is part of the Goat Island Arc (episodes 136-138), which is the third filler arc in the One Piece anime.

sources.title: Goat Island Arc - One Piece Wiki

trivia.fact: The Goat Island Arc was excluded from the 4Kids English dub, meaning this episode never aired in that version.

sources.title: Goat Island Arc - One Piece Wiki

trivia.fact: Zenny's name is a play on the Japanese word for money (zeni), reflecting his profession as a money lender.
This episode aired between the Alabasta Arc and the Jaya Arc, serving as a breather arc after the intense Alabasta storyline.
Zenny's dream of becoming the Pirate King parallels Luffy's dream, making him one of the few characters in One Piece who shares the exact same ambition as the protagonist.
Episode 137 has a 6.6/10 rating on IMDb, which is relatively low for One Piece episodes, reflecting mixed reception for filler content.
